parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the EMC can cause the vehicle to hesitate or not immediately accelerate when the accelerator pedal is depressed, leading to potential accidents or loss of control.
symptoms: The vehicle hesitates or does not immediately accelerate when the accelerator pedal is depressed
the VSC and Check Engine sensor indicators illuminate.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The transmission slipping and rolling backwards can cause loss of control, accidents, or near-miss accidents, especially when driving uphill or on inclines.
symptoms: The vehicle rolls backwards when taking foot off the brake pedal
the vehicle surges forward when accelerating
the vehicle hesitates or does not smoothly accelerate.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The internal failure of the transmission can cause loss of power, loud noises, and hesitation when shifting gears, leading to potential accidents or loss of control.
symptoms: makes a loud noise when shifting gears
hesitates or does not smoothly accelerate.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the power steering system can cause the steering wheel to become difficult to turn, leading to a loss of control, accidents, or near-miss incidents.
symptoms: Squeaking noise when turning the steering wheel
requiring excessive effort to turn the wheel.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Unintended Acceleration due to Accelerator Pedal Failure
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the accelerator pedal can cause unintended acceleration, leading to loss of vehicle control, accidents, and potential injuries or fatalities.
symptoms: and requires excessive braking to slow down.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Cruise Control Malfunction on Slick/Poor Road Surfaces
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The malfunction of the cruise control system on slick or poor road surfaces can cause the vehicle to spin out of control, leading to accidents, injuries, or fatalities.
symptoms: The vehicle attempts to accelerate to the set speed despite lack of traction
causing the vehicle to spin out of control

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Throttle Adjuster and Pedal Sensor Failure
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the throttle adjuster and pedal sensor can cause engine bucking and engine cut-out, leading to a potentially dangerous situation, especially when driving at high speeds.

Rodent damage to engine components, such as hoses, harnesses, and plastic covers, can cause fluid leaks, engine overheating, and potentially lead to engine failure, posing a risk to vehicle safety and occupant well-being.
